newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Analysts to trim Comalco 96 estimates.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Analysts to trim Comalco 96 estimates.

text.p: Bauxite miner and aluminium and alumina producer Comalco Ltd faces profit downgrades for calendar 1996 after reporting a disappointing first half result, Australian aluminium industry analysts said on Monday.

Comalco, 67 percent owned by CRA Ltd/RTZ Corp Plc, earlier reported a net profit before abnormals of A$43.9 million on a joint venture basis for the six months to June 30, 1996, down from A$155.1 million a year earlier.
The half year result was below analysts forecasts of between A$55 million and A$67 million. Comalco also declared a three cent dividend, which was well below expectations.
"It is a lot lower than what people were expecting," Macquarie Equities metals analyst Peter O'Connor told Reuters.

Analysts had forecast prior to the release of the first half result that Comalco would produce a net profit before abnormals of around A$130 million for the 1996 year, which would be well down on the A$232.3 million reported in the 1995 year.
"You would have to expect that numbers would be coming down to at least double of what the first half was," O'Connor said.
O'Connor said this would make the result about A$90 million.
At the start of 1996, analysts forecast Comalco to report a net profit of between A$255 million and A$265 million for 1996.
Analysts have trimmed back Comalco's profits this year, due to a weaker aluminium price and a stronger Australian dollar.

The three-month aluminium contract traded on the London Metal Exchange has fallen nearly 13 percent to its current level of US$1,479.0 from the start of the year while the Australian dollar has risen seven percent to around US$0.7900.
Analysts said that if the aluminiun price stayed at current levels it would eqaute to a net profit of about A$25 million for the Melbourne-based group in the second half.
Umit Safak, metals analyst at James Capel, said he would be lowering his forecast from the current A$130 million estimate.
